types.name: Paraffin Wax
types.description: Comprised of mostly straight chain hydrocarbons. Melting points 120F-160F.

types.name: Fully Refined Paraffin Wax (FRP)
types.description: Paraffin Wax with oil content <0.5%, + 30 color, FDA approvals.

types.name: Scale Wax
types.description: Paraffin wax 115F-150F melting points. Less than 5% oil content, >+10 color, some FDA approvals.

types.name: Microcrystalline Wax
types.description: Petroleum wax with a larger portion of branched hydrocarbon chains. Flexible, MP 140F-200F.

types.name: Semi-Refined Wax
types.description: Unfiltered waxes with similar qualities to refined and scale waxes except darker in color and lack FDA approvals.

types.name: Slack Wax
types.description: Unfinished waxes, higher oil content 10%-40%. Distinct petroleum odor.

types.name: Petrolatum
types.description: Also known as Petroleum Jelly. Available in finished and unfinished forms.

types.name: Natural Wax
types.description: Includes soy, palm, hydrogenated triglycerides, carnauba, montan, beeswax.

types.name: Polymerized Wax
types.description: Chemically modified waxes as additives in formulations to alter specs or characteristics.

types.name: Synthetic Wax
types.description: Includes Fischer Tropsch, alpha olefins, ethylene/propylene derived waxes.

types.name: Compounded Wax
types.description: Combinations of the above waxes blended for specific applications.
